base_note.note_text:
BRONCHOSCOPY NOTE
Date: 2025-07-27
Patient: Barbara White | MRN: 7502210 | Age: 68F
Attending: Dr. Thomas Green, MD
Location: Johns Hopkins Hospital, Baltimore, MD

INDICATION: Central airway mass visualized on CT extending from left mainstem into LUL orifice. Biopsy for diagnosis.

PROCEDURE: Flexible bronchoscopy with endobronchial biopsy

ANESTHESIA: Moderate sedation

FINDINGS: 
- Right lung: Normal
- Trachea: Normal
- Carina: Normal
- Left mainstem: Large polypoid, friable mass arising from posterior wall, extending to LUL orifice, causing approximately 60% obstruction

PROCEDURE: Multiple endobronchial biopsies (6) obtained using cup forceps. Moderate bleeding occurred, controlled with epinephrine (1:20,000) instillation and wedge technique. Specimens sent for surgical pathology.

SPECIMENS: Endobronchial biopsy LMS/LUL x 6

COMPLICATIONS: Moderate bleeding - controlled

IMPRESSION: Endobronchial mass LMS concerning for primary lung malignancy. Await pathology.

Dr. Thomas Green, MD

code_rationales.31625: Endobronchial biopsy of visible airway mass.

coding_review.overall_assessment: Endobronchial biopsy appropriate for visible lesion.

cpt_codes.description: Bronchoscopy; with bronchial or endobronchial biopsy(s)

variations.note_text:
INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY PROCEDURE DOCUMENTATION
============================================================

PATIENT IDENTIFICATION AND DEMOGRAPHICS
----------------------------------------
Patient: Evelyn Cox
Medical Record Number: 3193813
Date of Birth: N/A
Age at Procedure: N/A years
Procedure Date: 2024-12-09

CLINICAL INDICATION AND PREOPERATIVE ASSESSMENT
----------------------------------------
The patient presented with central airway mass - biopsy. Following comprehensive multidisciplinary evaluation and informed consent discussion detailing procedural risks, benefits, and alternatives, the patient elected to proceed with the proposed intervention.

PROCEDURAL METHODOLOGY AND TECHNIQUE
----------------------------------------

Endobronchial Biopsy:
Transbronchial lung parenchymal sampling was performed utilizing standard forceps technique with fluoroscopic localization to minimize pneumothorax risk. 

INTRAPROCEDURAL FINDINGS
----------------------------------------
- Right lung: Normal
- Trachea: Normal
- Carina: Normal
- Left mainstem: Large polypoid, friable mass arising from posterior wall, extending to LUL orifice, causing approximately 60% obstruction


POSTPROCEDURAL ASSESSMENT AND DISPOSITION
----------------------------------------
The procedure was completed without immediate complications. The patient demonstrated hemodynamic stability throughout and was transferred to the recovery area in satisfactory condition.

PROCEDURAL CODING DOCUMENTATION
----------------------------------------
Current Procedural Terminology Codes: 31625

This documentation has been prepared in accordance with institutional standards for procedural documentation and coding compliance.

PROCEDURE NOTE

Date: 2024-05-19
Patient: Timothy Ramirez
MRN: 1422174
Age/Sex: Noneyo patient

Attending Physician: [Attending]
Resident/Fellow: [Trainee, PGY-X]

INDICATION:
Central airway mass - biopsy

CONSENT:
Informed consent obtained. Risks, benefits, and alternatives discussed.
Patient verbalized understanding and agreed to proceed.

TIMEOUT:
Performed. Correct patient, procedure, and site confirmed.

SEDATION:
Moderate

PROCEDURE STEPS:
1. Patient positioned and monitored
2. Sedation administered per protocol
3. Topical anesthesia applied to airway
4. Endobronchial Biopsy performed
5. Scope withdrawn
6. Patient recovered without complication

SPECIMENS:
sent for surgical pathology.

COMPLICATIONS:
None

EBL:
Minimal

DISPOSITION:
To recovery, stable condition

CPT CODES: 31625

ATTESTATION:
I was present for the entire procedure and agree with the above documentation.
[Attending Signature]

variations.note_text:
On 2024-06-21, Carl Henderson, a None-year-old patient (MRN 2733350), underwent bronchoscopic evaluation for Central airway mass - biopsy. The patient received Moderate and the procedure was performed in standard fashion. The procedure included transbronchial biopsy for tissue sampling. 

On examination, the airways were systematically inspected. Abnormal findings were noted as described in detail above. The procedure was completed without immediate complications. 

The patient tolerated the procedure well and was transferred to the recovery area in stable condition. Specimens obtained were sent for appropriate analysis and results will be reviewed at follow-up. The preliminary assessment is malignancy suspected. 

Procedural coding: 31625.
